intro: Oropetium roxburghianum, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the Himalayas and thrives in high-altitude regions with cool and moist climates. The plant features a short, thick stem with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family, and are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Oropetium roxburghianum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
